full_summary:
### Request for Standing Offers - Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada

#### Background

The Farm Debt Mediation Service (FDMS) was established under the Farm Debt Mediation Act (FDMA) to provide a streamlined process of mediation to assist insolvent farmers and their creditors in negotiating settlement arrangements. The service has been in operation since April 1, 1998.

#### Request for Standing Offers

Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC) invites suppliers to submit their offers for the provision of mediation services to farmers in Quebec under the FDMS. The total budget for this Request for Standing Offers (RFSO) is approximately $765,000.00.

The purpose of this RFSO is to select offerors to enter into negotiations with AAFC to issue Departmental Individual Standing Offers (SO) to obtain the services described in the Statement of Work.

#### Key Requirements

*   Farm Debt Mediation Act (FDMA) and Farm Debt Mediation Service (FDMS)
*   Provision of services for a period of five (5) years
*   Total budget of approximately $765,000.00

#### Evaluation Criteria

The evaluation of bids will be based on the following criteria:

*   Technical merit
*   Price

#### Call-up Process

AAFC will issue call-ups to the selected offerors for the provision of mediation services. The call-up process will outline the scope of work, timeline, and any other relevant details.

#### Tendering Method

This tender is to be rated randomly using the two-envelope system. The first envelope contains the bids in a sealed envelope, which will be rated based on the evaluation criteria.

Packages must be submitted in two (2) envelopes:

1.  The first envelope should be, marked FDMS Tender RFSO (RFQ) with:
    *   The title of the package
    *   The date and time of submission
    *   The contact information:
        -   Name:Last Name, Respondent's Name
        -   Title: Position (e.g. General Manager)
        -   Telephone: Fax (Telephone)
        -   Company Name: Abbreviated Name of the company (if any)
        -   Address: Contact Address (institutions, agencies, etc.)
2.  The second sealed envelope, the short-listed bundles with the following details:
    *   Proposal presentation
    *   Commercial offer

The evaluation committee will evaluate the shortlisted packages based on the evaluation  criteria and the best value
